issues.title: Unchecked CALL return value
issues.description:
The return value of a low-level call is not checked. Consequently, the execution flow does not change if the call fails. Attention should be paid to the return value of low-level calls, as it indicates whether the call was successful.

Impact: Failing to check the return value of an external call can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities, such as incorrect state updates and denial-of-service conditions.
issues.debug: The return value of the call to msg.sender is not checked. The execution flow continues regardless of whether the call succeeds or fails.

issues.title: State change after external call
issues.description:
The contract account state is updated after an external call. Consider that the called contract could re-enter the function before this state update takes place. This can lead to reentrancy vulnerabilities.

Impact: An attacker can exploit the reentrancy vulnerability to withdraw more funds than they are entitled to. This can result in a loss of funds for the contract.
issues.debug: State change (credit[msg.sender]-=amount;) happens after an external call (msg.sender.call.value(amount)()).
